llm_text:
Why:
The model flag is driven primarily by payment_format_ach (value=1; SHAP=+2.83419 → increase), indicating an ACH payment strongly raises the score. Large transaction size (amount_received=13014.3; SHAP=+1.04510 → increase and amount_paid=13014.3; SHAP=+0.64865 → increase) further push the score upward. Sending bank (from_bank=214322; SHAP=+0.36542 → increase) also contributes positively to the alert.

Conclusion:
The alert stems from an ACH transfer of ~13,014.3 (payment_format_ach and both amount features increasing risk) with an elevated contribution from from_bank. If these feature values accurately reflect the payment, the model’s output reasonably escalated the transaction score; conversely, any correction to those specific features would likely reduce the score.
